It performs several checks to ensure the integrity and correctness of the meter data, such as verifying the existence of meters, checking date ranges, validating meter numbers, and ensuring the correctness of calculated values. The procedure uses a transaction to ensure that all validations are performed consistently, and it handles errors by rolling back the transaction and logging detailed error information.

The complexity of this stored procedure is medium. It involves multiple validation checks, uses transactions, and includes error handling with detailed logging. The logic is straightforward but involves several SQL operations and joins, which require a good understanding of the database schema and business rules.

: Checks if any meters or accounts in the upload data do not exist in the system as active or new.
: Validates that meter numbers are exactly 9 characters long.
: Verifies that the calculated CCF (hundred cubic feet) matches the expected value based on readings and a fixed factor.
: Ensures meter reading dates fall within the account's billing date range.
: Checks if any corrector IDs are associated with more than one meter.
: Outputs the counts of each type of validation failure.
: Commits the transaction if all validations pass.
: Catches any errors, logs detailed error information, sets the status code to 1, and rolls back the transaction.

CREATE PROCEDURE [CrisNationalGridWest].[usp_CRIS_ValidateMeterData]
	@BillingPeriod varchar(6),
	@authenticatedID int,
	@StatusCode int  OUTPUT      
   
 AS 
 BEGIN
		--********************************************************************************
		--	Author: MOHAMMED BELARREM
		--	Description: Validate the meter information before processing
		--
		--		--  validation rules
		--			* Meter should exist in the system as active, or in the exchange table as potentially new
		--			* FromDate <= ToDate
		--			* Meter dates should be within the account range	
		--			* Meter Number should be 9 characters
		--			* CCF = ( ToReading - FromReading ) x FixFactor
		--			* 
		--		
		--
		--
		--	Log: 
		--		06/10/2010	MOH	Create
		--		06/29/2010	MOH Update: changes the account meter combination lookup to go by originalmeternumber since they are reporting it on the 
		--								meters at the time of transaction
		--      09/23/2010  MOH Update: changed the query for unknown accounts to include turned off accounts and meters
		--		11/05/2010  MOH Update: Added @CountOfMeterCorrectotIDAssociatedWithMultipleMeters to monitor the corrector ID if they are associated with multiple meters
		--      12/28/2018  VY  Update: Modified for UniqueSeqIDs
		--********************************************************************************
	 
		--********************************************************************************
		DECLARE @AccountNumber acctnum
		DECLARE @MeterNumber MeterNumber

		DECLARE @CountOfUnknownAccountMeterCombination INT
		DECLARE @CountOfFlippedDates INT
		DECLARE @CountOfInvalidMeterNumber INT
		DECLARE @CountOfInvalidCCF INT 
		DECLARE @CountOfMetersOutsideAccountBillingRange INT
		DECLARE @CountOfMeterCorrectotIDAssociatedWithMultipleMeters INT 
		
		declare @crlf varchar(2)
		set @crlf = CHAR(13) + CHAR(10) 

	
			
		begin try	
		
				begin TRANSACTION MeterValidation
				set @StatusCode  = 0
				
				
				--* Meter should exist in the system as active, or in the exchange table as potentially new
				
				-- return a list of unknows accounts or meters
				SELECT @CountOfUnknownAccountMeterCombination = COUNT(*) 
				FROM 
					( 
						SELECT distinct AllAccountsAndMeters.OriginalAccountNumber, AllAccountsAndMeters.OriginalMeterNumber, UploadMeterReadDetail.AccountNumber, MeterNumber,UtilityServiceAccountName,UtilityServiceAddress
						FROM
						CrisNationalGridWest.UploadMeterReadDetail
						LEFT JOIN 
						(
							SELECT DISTINCT Billing.Account.OriginalAccountNumber, Billing.Meter.OriginalMeterNumber FROM Billing.Account
							INNER JOIN Billing.AccountExchangeMeterTrack ON Billing.Account.AccountSeqid = Billing.AccountExchangeMeterTrack.OriginalAccountSeqid 
							INNER JOIN Billing.Meter ON Billing.AccountExchangeMeterTrack.OriginalMeterSeqid = Billing.Meter.MeterSeqid 
							WHERE CurrentInvoiceAccountGroup = 3 AND AccountStatus IN  ('28', 'AC' , '46' ) AND MeterStatus IN ('27', 'AC', '46', '45')
							UNION ALL 
							SELECT DISTINCT CurrentAccountNumber + '0000' AS OriginalAccountNumber, CurrentMeterNumber AS CurrentMeterNumber 
							FROM Common.ExchangeData  --CrisNationalGridWest.UploadExchangeDetail
							WHERE ExchangeCode IN ('45' , '46' , '47') --AND ActivityCode <> 717
						) AS AllAccountsAndMeters					
						ON CrisNationalGridWest.UploadMeterReadDetail.AccountNumber = AllAccountsAndMeters.OriginalAccountNumber 
						AND CrisNationalGridWest.UploadMeterReadDetail.MeterNumber = AllAccountsAndMeters.OriginalMeterNumber 
						WHERE AllAccountsAndMeters.OriginalAccountNumber IS NULL OR AllAccountsAndMeters.OriginalMeterNumber  IS NULL
					) allCombinations
	
				--* FromDate <= ToDate
				SELECT @CountOfFlippedDates = COUNT(*) 
				FROM CrisNationalGridWest.UploadMeterReadDetail
				WHERE MeterReadingFromDate > MeterReadingToDate 
				
				--* Meter Number should be 9 characters
				SELECT @CountOfInvalidMeterNumber = COUNT(*) 
				FROM CrisNationalGridWest.UploadMeterReadDetail
				WHERE LEN(MeterNumber) <> 9 


				SELECT @CountOfInvalidCCF = COUNT(*) 
				FROM CrisNationalGridWest.UploadMeterReadDetail
				WHERE (abs(MeterCCF) <> CAST (ROUND(POWER(10, MeterConstant -1) * (MeterToReading - MeterFromReading) * CAST(FixFactor AS DECIMAL(6,4)), 0 ) AS INT) and HasMeterRolledOver = 'N' ) 
				

				--* Meter dates should be within the account range	
				SELECT @CountOfMetersOutsideAccountBillingRange = COUNT(*)
				FROM 
				CrisNationalGridWest.UploadMeterReadDetail
				INNER JOIN 
				( 
					SELECT AccountNumber , MIN(billingFromDate) AS MinFromDate, MAX(billingToDate) AS MaxToDate
					FROM CrisNationalGridWest.UploadAccountBillingDetail
					GROUP BY AccountNumber
				) AS AccountRangeOfBilling
				ON CrisNationalGridWest.UploadMeterReadDetail.AccountNumber = AccountRangeOfBilling.AccountNumber
				WHERE MeterReadingFromDate < MinFromDate OR MeterReadingToDate > MaxToDate
				
				
				
				SELECT @CountOfMeterCorrectotIDAssociatedWithMultipleMeters = COUNT( * )
				FROM 
				(
					SELECT b.MeterCorrectorID  , ( SELECT COUNT( DISTINCT  MeterNumber ) FROM CrisNationalGridWest.UploadMeterReadDetail a WHERE a.MeterCorrectorID = b.MeterCorrectorID ) AS MeterCount	 
					FROM CrisNationalGridWest.UploadMeterReadDetail b
					WHERE MeterCorrectorID IS NOT NULL 
					GROUP BY  MeterCorrectorID
				) AS MeterCorrectorsAndCountOfMeters
				WHERE MeterCount > 1

				
				
				-- show results
				SELECT	
						@CountOfUnknownAccountMeterCombination AS CountOfUnknownAccountMeterCombination  
						,@CountOfFlippedDates AS CountOfFlippedDates
						,@CountOfInvalidMeterNumber AS CountOfInvalidMeterNumber
						,@CountOfInvalidCCF AS CountOfInvalidCCF
						,@CountOfMetersOutsideAccountBillingRange AS CountOfMetersOutsideAccountBillingRange
						,@CountOfMeterCorrectotIDAssociatedWithMultipleMeters AS CountOfMeterCorrectotIDAssociatedWithMultipleMeters	
				

				commit TRANSACTION MeterValidation


		END TRY
		BEGIN CATCH
		
				DECLARE @CustomErrorMessage NVARCHAR(4000);
				DECLARE @ErrorMessage NVARCHAR(4000);
				DECLARE @ErrorSeverity INT;
				DECLARE @ErrorState INT;
				DECLARE @ErrorNumber INT;
				DECLARE @ErrorLine INT;
				DECLARE @ErrorProcedure NVARCHAR(126);
				--
				SELECT 
					@CustomErrorMessage ='Error in StoredProcedure %s at line number %d' + @crlf + 'Billing Period: %s' + @crlf + 'Account:Meter (%s : %s)  ' + @crlf,
					@ErrorMessage	= ERROR_MESSAGE(),
					@ErrorSeverity	= ERROR_SEVERITY(),
					@ErrorState		= ERROR_STATE(),
					@ErrorNumber	= ERROR_NUMBER(),
					@ErrorProcedure = ERROR_PROCEDURE(),
					@ErrorLine		= ERROR_LINE();			
				--
				set	@ErrorMessage = @CustomErrorMessage + @ErrorMessage + @crlf + 'ErrorNumber: ' + cast(@ErrorNumber as varchar(10)) + @crlf
				--
				RAISERROR (@ErrorMessage, -- Message text.
						   @ErrorSeverity, -- Severity.
						   @ErrorState, -- State.
						   @ErrorProcedure,
						   @ErrorLine,
						   @BillingPeriod,
						   @AccountNumber,
						   @MeterNumber
						   ) with log;
				
				set @StatusCode  = 1
						   
				ROLLBACK TRANSACTION MeterValidation	
						   
		END CATCH




	
 end
